Ashurboy has planned for a few years to build a new home but he doesn't have the money.  His house isn't up to housing codes and he must immediately build a new one.  He is asking for a loan of 15,000 KGS to buy building materials like cement, wood, sand, etc.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, soil to build a new house

loans.name: Esanaly

texts.ru: Эсанали четвертый цикл кредитуется в ИМОНе. Он добросовестный, честный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Эсанали работает более 5 лет в заводе по производству цемента. Его жена работает медсестрой. Он нуждается финансовой поддержке. Эсанали планирует использовать кредит для покупки строительных материалов для постройки жилого дома. Он хочет достроить новый дом до зимы. Он запрашивает займ для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, кирпич и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ему улучшить условию проживания.
texts.en: Esanaly is on his fourth loan cycle with IMON.  He is a conscientious, honest and dedicated man.  He is married and has two children.  Esanaly has worked in a cement factory for more than five years.  His wife works as a nurse.  He needs financial support.  Esanaly plans to use this loan to buy building materials to build a new home.  He wants to build it before winter.  He will use the funds to buy materials like cement, bricks, etc.  He awaits your kindness as this loan will help him improve his family's circumstances.

loans.use: To buy cement, bricks, etc., to build a house

loans.name: Raima

texts.ru: Раима родилась и выросла в сельской местности. Ей 51 года. Она с детства помогала родителям по скотоводству и выращиванием сельхоз культур. Раима замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Раима более 10 лет занимается самостоятельно скотоводством и выращиванием сельхоз культур. Раима является основной кормилицей в семье, так как ее муж Утаган работает учителем в школе и получает маленькую зарплату. Ее сыновья подрабатывают разнорабочими в Российской Федерации. В прошлом сезоне из-за не благополучной погоды она не смогла получить намеченный урожай. Она должна построить дом для своего старшего сына, так как он хочет жениться. Раима не имеет достаточно денег для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, древесина, кирпич и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Raima was born and raised in a rural area.  She is 51 years old.  Since her childhood, she has helped her parents with livestock and farming.  Raima is married and has three children.  For more than 10 years she has had her own livestock and farming activities.  She is the main breadwinner for the family since her husband woks as a teacher in a school and receives little pay.  Her sons are migrant workers in Russia.  Last season, because of bad weather, Raima's crops were ruined.  She needs to build a house for her oldest son since he wants to marry.  She doesn't have enough money to buy the construction materials like cement, wood, bricks., etc.  She awaits your kindness and relies on your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cement, wood, and brick to build a house for her son

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 57 years old and the father of one child, who is currently studying in school. 

For the last three years, Julius has earned a living by selling goods and services from his general store in Malindi where he earns a monthly profit of KES 30,000. Julius was introduced to Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) by a credit officer and he is applying for his first loan of KES 70,000/= to purchase additional stock needed for his business. 

He will use the profit from the business to pay for school fees, purchase food for the family, and expand the current business. Julius hopes to own his own supermarket in future, so as to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for his general store business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a 28-year-old rice and corn farmer from the community of Talibon,  Bohol.  She is married with two children ages 2 and 7. Rowena’s husband works as a carpenter. They are struggling to keep their farm while meeting the needs of their children. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. 

Rowena knows that with proper care and good growth attributed to fertilizer she can be successful in her farming. In the future, she hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Gema Dolores

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Gema, tiene 21 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tiene una hija de 3 años de edad, ella vive en casa de los padres. 

Doña Gema es una joven mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y con su esfuerzo sacar adelante a su hija para lo cual se dedica al comercio, vende ropa por catálogos, carteras  y ciertos perfumes y bisutería, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale a recorrer por la ciudad donde tiene muchos sus clientes, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, ella tiene 1 año con este negocio el cual empezó con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución y por lo cual está muy agradecida, así ella se gana el sustento de ella y el de su hija.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, carteras, perfumes, entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva más de un año en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio.  

Su sueño es que a su hija no le falte nada.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Pedregal" meets every 15 days in El Pedregal, in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  This is a place that is known for its commercial activity, its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivals, and the happiness of its people.

This is where Gema, 21, lives.  She is separated, but has a 3 year-old daughter from this relationship.  She lives in her parent's house.

Gema is a young woman who likes to be self-sufficient.  With her efforts, she is supporting her daughter.  She works in retail trade, selling clothing through catalogs, handbags, certain perfumes, and accessories.  She sells door-to-door; she goes around the city where she has a lot of customers.  She sells on credit and collects every 15 days.  Gema's had this business for a year; she started out with the first loan that she received from the institution, for which she is very grateful.  This is how she has been supporting herself and her daughter.

Gema will use this loan to buy clothing, handbags, perfumes, and other products to sell.  She has been with her communal bank for more than a year, and she likes it because with her first loan, she started her business.

Gema's dream is to provide her daughter with everything she needs.

loans.use: to buy clothing, handbags, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah operates a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby, and in addition she also runs a vegetable stall. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. Annah dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and vegetables for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Jorge Sergio

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar para apoyar a su familia, Jorge no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Tallarín Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jorge trabaja como reponedor en un minimarket de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días dese tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Jorge se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jorge se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que estando en la época de invierno y lluvias, el desea comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar el techado de su hogar, de esta manera Jorge brindará mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio negocio comercial.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 21-year-old single man living in the city of Ica with his parents and siblings.  He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who has a strong desire for self-improvement.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to start working to support his family, Jorge has been unable to study a professional career.  In his free time he enjoys watching movies and sometimes cooks a delicious Tallarín Saltado [stir-fried noodles] to share with his family.

On his own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Jorge works as a stock clerk in a mini-mart in his city.  He works every day starting very early in the morning and works for about 10 hours.  Jorge feels good doing his work and believes that he does well because of his good work habits and the kind way he treats others.

Jorge is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to do some home improvements because during winter and the rainy season he wants to buy building supplies to repair the roof.   In this way, Jorge will provide better security and well-being for his family and he can continue to work and strive to reach his great dream of owning his own commercial business.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Angelica Cecilia

texts.es:
Angelica es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su esposo y su  pequeño hijo de 2 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar, Angelica no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando música y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Chicharrones de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Angelica trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida y hamburguesas, adicionalmente también vende ropa para damas y caballeros, ella ocupa un pequeño espacio en su vivienda para realizar sus ventas y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Angelica se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Angelica se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de prendas de vestir, adicionalmente comprará mesas y sillas para acondicionar su negocio de venta de comida, de esta manera Angelica brindará un mejor servicio y atenderá a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un auto que con ayuda de esposo trabajaran para brindar servicios de transporte en su ciudad.
texts.en:
Angélica is a 21-year-old woman living in the city of Ica, Parcona District, with her husband and two-year-old son who she loves and is her main reason for living.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who together with her husband focuses all their efforts into moving their family forward.   Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources and the need she has to work, Angélica has been unable to study the professional career of Business Administration like she wanted to.  In her free time she enjoys relaxing listening to music and occasionally cooks delicious fried chicken to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Angélica works in her small business selling food and hamburgers but also works selling clothes for women and men.  She occupies a small space at home to do her sales and can work for about 10 hours approximately.  Angélica feels good doing her work and believes she does well because of the good works he does and the kind customer service she provides.

Angélica is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided she will be able to buy larger amounts and wider variety of clothing; she will also buy tables and chairs to furnish her food sales business.  In this way, Angélica will be able to provide better service and tend to more customers and she will be able to continue working and striving to reach her great dream of owning a car that with her husband’s help they can use to provide transportation services in their city.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” 

Once the maize has been harvested from their fields, many farmers grow sunflowers on their land, which is an excellent source of forage for bees. Furthermore, many farmers have started projects planting blue gum trees, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. 

Kitale is located close to Mount Elgon, an extinct shield volcano that extends into both Uganda and Kenya. The people from around Mount Elgon have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Zipporah is married and has six children. Both she and her husband are engaged in activities around their farm, and are currently growing maize and coffee as well as manufacturing wood blocks. She is excited to start beekeeping because it is not a labour-intensive activity, and she also stated that “I love the environment and working with bees will necessitate me to improve it.”

This is her first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to pay school fees for her children. In the future, Zipporah hopes to improve her living standards and expand the projects on her farm.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina lives near Kamukuywa, near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” 

Once the maize has been harvested from their fields, many farmers grow sunflowers on their land, which is an excellent source of forage for bees. Furthermore, many farmers have started projects planting blue gum trees, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. Kitale is located close to Mount Elgon, an extinct shield volcano that extends into both Uganda and Kenya. The people from around Mount Elgon have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Carolina is married and has two children. Her husband works as a pastor, while she farms their land. She has been farming for six years, and is currently growing maize, bananas, beans and sugarcane. She is excited to become a beekeeper because she is a supporter of honey: it is a good food that is good for your health. 

This is Carolina’s first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to save for her children’s education fund.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru: Умеда молодая и энергичная женщина. Она вместе со своей семьей живет на северной части Таджикистана, где природа очень богатая и имеет хорошее условия для скотоводства и земледелие. Умеда замужем на хорошего человека и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. С целью того, чтобы прокормить семью, Умеда 10 лет назад начала свой бизнес земледелием. Она в основном выращивает пшеницу и картошку. Она имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Умеда хочет построить сарай для хранения пшеницы и картошки, но не имеет денег для покупки строительных материалов. Так как она живет на севере Таджикистана, влажность высокая, и она должна хранить урожай, который она выращивает с трудом в сухом месте, до того, как придут покупатели. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки кирпича и шифера. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Umeda is an energetic young woman. She and her family live in the northern part of Tajikistan, when the land is fertile and well-suited for livestock and agriculture. Umeda is married to a good man and has three children. Umeda began farming ten years ago in order to feed her family. She mainly grows wheat and potatoes but also earns income from raising cattle. Umeda wants to build a shed to store her wheat and potato crops, but she does not have enough money to buy building materials. Because it is humid in northern Tajikistan, she needs to store the crops in a dry place before selling them. She has asked for a loan of $1,000 in order to buy brick and slate. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy bricks and slate to build a shed

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflowers, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano. Its proximity to the dense Mount Elgon forest, as well as other neighboring forests, makes it a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Wycliffe is married and has thirteen children. His wife works as a tailor, while he farms their land. He has been farming for thirty-two years and has a very busy farm where he raises cattle and grows maize, beans, potatoes and millet. He likes beekeeping because “it is being done as a business and the pollination [of] my crops will enhance yield and quality.”

This is Wycliffe’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the income generated by his hives to “pay school fees for my children, improve my business, and invest in my farming to see my large family through.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
For two years now, Rodelia has been engaged in selling lumber, wood, and charcoal for an income. She is 36 years old, with three children, ages 11, 14, and 16, from Talibon, Bohol. 

Rodelia is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy more lumber and charcoal that she can resell to make a better profit. She hopes that, through her income, she can expand her business in the future and that her children can be given a proper education.

loans.use: to buy more lumber and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana es una señorita de 18 años de edad soltera,  viven junto a sus padres en el Caserío Xejuyu Primero San Andres Semetabaj, Sololá. Graduada de la Profesión de Maestra de Educación Infantil. Una mujer joven trabajadora que desea superarse económicamente  con su familia.
Ella se dedica actualmente a la producción de Hongos ostra (Pleurotus Ostreatus), con el apoyo de sus padres, ella puede mantener esta producción. 
Ahora tiene 7 años de realizar esta actividad la cual aprendió con sus padres  cuando aun estudiaba. Desea superar las condiciones de vida de su familia ya que es hija única.   
Ella ve que la producción de los hongos ostra ha tenido buenos resultados la cual desea producir más y tener mejores ganancias,  de este modo solicita un crédito de Q 5,500.00 para la compra de un estante de madera y micelio de hongo para su producción. 
Su mayor sueño es que para un futuro no muy lejano con los ingresos y las ganancias de este negocio pueda ampliar su producción, mejorando  las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is a young, single woman who is 18 years old. She lives with her parents in the Xejuyu Primero village in San Andres Semetabaj, Sololá. She is a graduate of an Early Childhood Education program. She is a young, hardworking woman who wants to improve her economic situation with her family. 

She makes a living by producing oyster mushrooms (Pleurotus Ostreatus). With the support of her parents, she is able to maintain the production. For the past 7 years, she has been performing this activity, which she learned with her parents while she was still studying.

She hopes to improve her family's quality of life since she is an only child. She has seen that the production of oyster mushrooms has had good results, which makes her want to produce more and have better profits. For this reason, she requests a loan of 5,500 quetzales to buy a wooden shelf and mushroom mycelium for her production. 

Her greatest dream is that in the near future, with her income and the profits from this business, she can expand her production, improving the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to produce oyster mushrooms.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María tiene 63 años de edad, es casada. Ella es una mujer que toda su vida a trabajo muy fuerte y desde hace 14 años trabaja en la carpintería, es un trabajo que lo aprendió de su esposo; ya que él toda la vida ha trabajado en la elaboración de muebles, ella vive solamente con su esposo y antes se dedicaba a oficios domésticos
Ella compra la madera en las fincas, lo cual le queda a una distancia de unos 60 kilómetros; por lo que tiene que madrugar y desplazarse a mucha distancia para obtener madera de buena calidad e incurrir costos en el traslado.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar madera de cedro, la cual es de muy buena calidad y le asegura que sus muebles queden muy bien. Al realizar la compra de la madera la señora y su esposo podrán elaborar un gabetero que le han encargado y así poderle cumplir al cliente.

Con la venta del mueble, ella podrá generar ingresos, los cuales serán aprovechados en los pagos de sus compromisos y los gastos de su hogar (alimentación y servicios públicos)


Ella manifiesta que desea seguir trabajando siempre en la fabricación de muebles para continuar manteniendo los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
María is 63-years old and married.  She is a woman who has worked very hard her whole life.  She has worked in carpentry for the last fourteen years, a trade she learned from her husband.  Her husband has worked his whole life making furniture.  María only lives with her husband, and previously spent her time in domestic duties. 

María purchases the wood from the farms, which are about 60 kilometers away.  Which means she needs to get up very early and travel a great distance to obtain good quality wood.  She also incurs expenses transporting the wood. 

The loan that María is requesting from Fundación Campo is for purchasing cedar wood, which is very good quality and assures that her furniture will also be good quality.  Once they purchase the wood, María and her husband will be able to make a chest of drawers that has been ordered and thereby fill the customer's order. 

By selling furniture, María will be able to generate income, which will be helpful in paying back her loans and meeting her household expenses (food and public services). 

María states that she wants to always work making furniture in order to meet the household expenses.

loans.use: with the purchase of cedar wood, which is very high quality and ensures that her furniture is also good quality.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto es un hombre de 65 años de edad, padre de 2 hijos, actualmente no tiene esposa, pues ésta falleció. Hace 5 años se dedica a atender un negocio de venta de computadores y accesorios para tecnología, inicialmente laboraba como empleado, pero hace un año se le presentó la oportunidad de comprar el negocio. El señor Luis es trabajador y muy dedicado, labora largas jornadas diarias desde las 8:00 am hasta las 7:00 pm, con el fin de obtener los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar y suplir las necesidades básicas. Con el crédito que solicita en la Corporación desea pagar una factura a un proveedor al que le compró mercancía en oferta (accesorios para celular, para computadores, cargadores, cámaras) para aprovechar el buen precio que le ofrecían y así poder tener más variedad de productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Su principal meta es hacer crecer su negocio y convertirlo en una gran distribuidora de tecnología, que sea reconocida en el sector y así mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is a 65-year-old man and a father of 2 children. He is not currently married because his wife passed away.

5 years ago, he began working as an assistant in a business that sells computers and accessories for electronic devices. He initially began working as an employee, but a year ago, he was presented with the opportunity to buy the business.

Luis is hardworking and very dedicated. He works long hours every day, from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm, with the goal of earning the necessary income to support his household and supply basic necessities. 

With the loan that he seeks from the Corporation, he hopes to pay the invoice from a supplier from whom he bought merchandise at a discount (accessories for cell phones and computers, chargers, cameras) in order to take advantage of the good price that they offered and to be able to have a greater variety of products to offer his customers.

His main goal is to grow his business and become a large distributor of technology that is recognized in the area and to increase his income and quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the invoice of a supplier from whom he bought merchandise at a discount (accessories for cell phones and computers, chargers, cameras).

loans.name: Phyllis

texts.en:
Phyllis lives outside of Kamukuywa, close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of Western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway, which has fallen into a state of disrepair in recent years. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped to both preserve the region’s soil and ensure that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Phyllis is married, and has three children. Both she and her husband farm, and are currently growing maize, sweet potatoes, and cassava on their land. Phyllis likes beekeeping because honey is a good food, and will provide a good source of income from her farm. 

This is Phyllis’ first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to educate her children and to buy a plot of land in town for business development. Phyllis’ hope for the future is to improve her family’s livelihood.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. 

Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew, due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway, which has fallen into a state of disrepair in recent years. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Emmanuel is married, and has two children. His wife works as a businesswoman, while Emmanuel farms his land. He has been farming for four years and is currently growing maize, avocados, and mangoes on his land. When asked what he liked about beekeeping, Emmanuel said, “I love honey and the honey money will be sweet, too.”

This is Emmanuel’s first loan and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to help him buy a dairy cow. Emmanuel’s hope for the future is “to uplift his livelihood.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Niña

texts.en:
Niña is 27 years old, from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married, with three children, ages 6, 7, and 8. Niña’s husband works as a welder, while she has operated a sari-sari store for three years now. 

She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, like Pepsi, and beer. 

Niña works hard, so she can provide for the needs of her family. In the future, she hopes that she can successfully send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, like Pepsi, and beer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of Western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Once the maize has been harvested from their fields, many farmers grow sunflower on their land, which is an excellent source of forage for bees. Furthermore, many farmers have started projects planting bluegum trees, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. Kitale is located close to Mount Elgon, an extinct shield volcano that extends into both Uganda and Kenya. The people from around Mount Elgon have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  
	
Mary is married, and has six children. Both she and her husband farm, and are currently growing sugar cane, cassava, and various fruit trees on their land. Mary is excited to start beekeeping because “honey is good food and it is also a source of income.”

This is Mary’s first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to educate her children and buy a dairy cow. Her hope for the future is to increase her number of beehives and “start a serious dairy farm.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry lives outside of Kamukuywa, close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya and, at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. 

The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Once the maize has been harvested from their fields, many farmers grow sunflowers on their land, which is an excellent source of forage for bees. Furthermore, many farmers have started projects planting blue gum trees, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. 

Kitale is located close to Mount Elgon, an extinct shield volcano that extends into both Uganda and Kenya. The people from around Mount Elgon have been beekeeping for centuries and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Henry is married, and has two children. He works as a pastor and also farms, while his wife works full-time as a farmer. They are currently growing millet and maize on their land. Henry is excited to start beekeeping because “it is bringing wealth” and he is grateful to Kiva lenders because they have allowed him to buy beehives “on flexible payment terms.”

This is Henry’s first Kiva loan with Honey Care Africa and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to help educate his children and expand his business opportunities. His hope for the future is to see his children well-educated and to help some of his more needy parishioners.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Edwin Misael

texts.es:
Edwin es un joven de 25 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos. se dedica  a la agricultura,desde que tiene 12 años, pues lo aprendió con su papá,hoy con mas deseos lo ejerce; pues es una forma de ganarse la vida y mantener a su familia. a demás con su compañera de vida tienen una pequeña tienda, la cual a tiende ella y cuando él llega del trabajo le ayuda. para salir a tiempo con todas sus actividades se levanta a las cinco de la mañana para prepararse, y luego conducirse a donde trabaja que esta a unas seis horas y luego regresa a su casa,para poder compartir con sus hijas.
Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, debe desplazarse en la palancana de un pick up que tarda una hora en realizar su recorrido. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una bolsa de semilla, dos galones de hervidas,dos litros de pesticidas, 10 sacos de abono. De esta forma, aplicara los insumos correctos, en el tiempo justo para que no se pierda la cosecha y le genere perdidas porque ya efectuó una inversión fruto de sus ahorros. 

su sueño es que sus hijas estudien,ademas sueña con poder comprar un terreno para construir su propia casa, ya que hoy vive en casa de su suegra.
texts.en:
Edwin is 25 and lives with his two daughters and their mother. He has been a farmer since he was 12, having learned from his father. Today Edwin wishes to keep farming as he can earn a living and support his family. 

Edwin and his partner also have a store that she manages; he helps her in the store after he comes home from work. To meet all of his daily responsibilities on time, Edwin has to wake up at five a.m. and then drive six hours to where the land he works. He comes home at the end of the day to spend time with his daughters.  

To purchase farming supplies, Edwin has to ride in the back of a pickup truck for an hour. 

Edwin is requesting a loan from the Fundación Campo to purchase a bag of seeds, two gallons of beans, two liters of pesticides, and ten bags of manure. With the proper inputs, Edwin will have time to preserve his harvest so he won't suffer losses. He's already used savings to invest in his farm. 

Edwin's dream is for his daughters to study. He also hopes to be able to purchase land and build his own home, as he now lives in his mother-in-law's house.

loans.use: to purchase a bag of seeds, two gallons of beans, two liters of pesticides, and ten bags of manure.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel, de 44 años de edad, está casada con Rodolfo con quien tiene 02 hijos de 24 y 13 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. Raquel se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, así como zapatos que trae a pedido desde otra ciudad, para  luego venderlos de forma personal a sus vecinos y familiares, muchas veces al contado como también a crédito. Lleva en está actividad un promedio de 08 años y lo realiza sola, tanto en la compra como en la venta. Le gusta su actividad pues le permite  socializar con las personas y brindarles buenos productos. Este es su sexto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará ropa de diversos modelos y marcas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Raquel, 44 years old, is married to Rodolfo, with whom she has 2 children, 24 and 13; she lives with them in her own house. Raquel makes her living selling women’s, men’s, and children’s clothes, as well as shoes, which she brings by request from another city and then personally sells to her neighbors and relatives, often in cash and also on credit. She has been doing this activity for about 8 years, and she works alone, both buying and selling. 
This is her sixth loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful to receive financial support that allows her to keep moving forward. Also, she promises to make her payments on time. With the requested amount of 1500 nuevos soles, she will buy clothes of various brands and designs at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth operates a fish selling business. With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase sacks of dry fish for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a depot for fish selling in the future. In addition she also operates a business selling vegetables to supplement her income.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of dry fish for resale.

loans.name: Neris Antonia

texts.es:
Doña Neris es originaria de Estelí, se dedica a la  Venta  de ropa usada y zapatos. Al  recibir el primer crédito su negocio  mejoro, ya que antes lo tenía en su casa donde no era un buen punto de venta y ahora tiene su propio local. El crédito lo utilizo para  comprar ropa usada. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que a recibido del financiamiento kiva. 
Hoy solicita este nuevo crédito para comprar más ropa usada, ya que tiene demanda de sus productos y necesita satisfacer las necesidades de sus cliente, su meta es seguir comercializando y en un futuro vender en las comunidades. Espera seguir con el apoyo de MiCrédito  y Kiva ya que es de mucha ayuda para ella.
texts.en:
Doña Neris is a native or Estelí.  She makes her living selling used clothing and shoes.  When she received her first loan, her business improved.  Previously she had her business set up in her house, which wasn't a good sales location.  She now has her own shop.  She used the loan to purchase used clothing.  Doña Neris is very grateful for the help she has received through Kiva financing. 
Today, doña Neris is requesting a new loan to purchase more used clothing.  There is a demand for her products, and she needs to meet her customers' needs.  Her goal is to keep selling and in the future, to sell in the communities.  Doña Neris wants to continue to work with MiCrédito and Kiva, as they are a big help for her.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan lives close to Kamukuywa, near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway, which has fallen into a state of disrepair in recent years. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Jonathan is married and has three children. His wife works as a teacher, while he farms their land and sells their produce at the Kamukuywa market. He has been farming for twenty years and has a very busy farm. He is growing maize and bananas, tending to a eucalyptus tree plantation, and raising cattle.  Jonathan is excited to start beekeeping because it is a low labour business that he has wished to engage in for some time. 

Jonathan’s hope for the future is to become a model beekeeper in his county, and to do beekeeping on a large scale. He plans to use the income generated by his beehives to develop his plot at the market, and to help cover the fees of the very needy students at the school he started for young children.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael lives outside of Kamukuywa, near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway, which has fallen into a state of disrepair in recent years. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensure that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Michael is married and has three children. Both he and his wife do farming work, and Michael also does beekeeping. They are currently growing maize, groundnuts, beans and bananas on their land. 

This is Michael’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the income to pay for his children’s school fees. In the future, Michael’s dream is to be a large scale beekeeper as well as build a shop in town where he owns a plot.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy lives on a small farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Once the maize has been harvested from their fields, many farmers grow sunflowers on their land, which is an excellent source of forage for bees. Furthermore, many farmers have started projects planting bluegum trees, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. Kitale is located close to Mount Elgon, an extinct shield volcano that extends into both Uganda and Kenya. The people from around Mount Elgon have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Timothy is unmarried, and has been farming for six years. He is currently growing maize, sugarcane, sunflowers and beans on his land. He likes beekeeping because it is an extra source of income with low labour costs, and is grateful to Kiva lenders for giving him the opportunity to buy beehives on loan. 

This is Timothy’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to start a small business at the Chalicha market centre nearby. In the future, Timothy’s dream is to marry and have his own family.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Doli

texts.es:
Doli, de 52 años de edad , está casada y tiene 6 hijos a quienes brindó educación y buenos modales, ahora solo vive con una de sus hijas y sus 3 nietos en su casa propia. Doli se dedica a la venta de ropa, sandalias, zapatillas y otros accesorios de uso cotidiano. Toda su mercadería es enviada en grandes paquetes por una de sus hijas desde otra ciudad, cuando recibe su encargo selecciona los artículos que luego pondrá a la venta. Diariamente sale en busca de sus clientes por las calles de la ciudad, lleva consigo toda su mercadería para ofrecerlas de casa en casa, su modalidad de trabajo es al contado o al crédito y la cobranza lo realiza en forma diaria, semanal o quincenal. Por otra parte, cuando no consigue vender todo en la ciudad, viaja a los centros poblados que se encuentran cerca de la ribera de los ríos, ahí consigue vender todo y regresa a su casa muy contenta, después de aproximadamente 10 días de haber salido de la ciudad. Empezó con este oficio hace 2 años, trabaja sola y está muy satisfecha con su labor. Le gusta su trabajo porque le permite disponer de su tiempo y utilizarlo en otras actividades con mucha comodidad, además ha aprendido a ganarse el respeto y la confianza de los clientes en base a su buen trato y su gran sonrisa, tiene buenas ventas y como resultado de ello obtiene buenas ganancias económicas, ahora espera seguir creciendo y más adelante  conseguir un puesto de ventas para continuar con su trabajo. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000 soles y está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante con sus negocios, además se compromte a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería conformada por ropa al por mayor para damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
Doli, age 52, is married and has six children. She has provided them with an education and good manners. She now lives with only one of her daughters and three grandchildren in her own home. Doli sells clothing, sandals, high-heeled shoes, and other common accessories. All her merchandise is sent in from another city in large packages by one of her daughters. When Doli receives her orders, she selects the articles that she will later put up for sale. She goes out every day through the streets of the city looking for customers. She brings all her merchandise along to offer door-to-door. She sells for cash or on credit, and charges daily, weekly, or every five weeks. When she is unable to sell everything in the city, she travels to other population centres near the riverbank; she is able to sell everything there and will return home, approximately ten days after having left, very happy. 
Doli started this business two years ago. She works alone and is very satisfied with her work. She enjoys her work because it allows her to take advantage of her time and use it for other activities very comfortably. She has learned how to win the respect and confidence of her clients because of her good service and big smile. She has good sales, and thus makes a good income. Now she hopes to continue to expand her business and buy a stall in the future to continue with her work. 
She is requesting 3000 soles and is very happy to know that she will have financial support that will allow her to continue moving forward with her business. She promises to repay her quotas punctually. She will invest this loan in the wholesale purchase of merchandise: clothing for men, women, and children.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Jenny Marleny

texts.es:
Jenny es una mujer de 37 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su esposo y sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Jenny no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Pedagogía, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Caldo de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jenny trabaja como empleada del hogar, brindando servicios de limpieza, cocina y cuidados en diversas casas de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas.
Jenny se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de estudios de su hija mayor, la cual se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de turismo y realiza muchos viajes académicos, por ello Jenny desea poder ayudar de esta manera a su hija, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Jenny is a 37-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Ica in the Santiago district with her husband and two children. She loves them very much and they are her main reason for living. She is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person. She and her husband give their all to get their family ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and because she had to start working at a very young age, Jenny was unable to study to be a teacher. In her free time, she likes to entertain herself by watching television. Sometimes she cooks a delicious Caldo de Gallina [Chicken Soup] to share with her family.
On her own initiative, with great hard work and dedication, Jenny works as a household assistant, providing cleaning, cooking, and personal care services for several households in the city. She works every day, starting very early in the morning, and she is able to work for approximately eight hours.
Jenny is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to cover her eldest daughter's study costs. Her daughter is studying tourism and travels a lot for her studies. Jenny wants to be able to help her daughter this way. She will continue to work hard to achieve her great dream: to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's study costs.

loans.name: Altise

texts.en: Altise has already taken out three loans to launch her clean energy retail business. She is selling her EarthSpark clean energy products on a rent-to-own basis in her community. After renting out the entire inventory she bought with her last loan and still has customers calling her with more orders. She is taking out a fourth loan to help meet the demand in her community for a source of renewable energy that will allow customers save money while helping the environment.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Wilibaldo Bruno

texts.es:
Wilibaldo es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar para apoyar a su familia, Wilibaldo no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad que desea, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con su amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Wilibaldo trabaja en un centro comercial vendiendo electrodomésticos, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Wilibaldo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una moto lineal de segunda mano, ya que de esta, manera Wilibaldo podrá desplazarse desde las lejanías de su hogar hasta su trabajo, así el podrá ahorrar dinero en transporte, para luego poder utilizarlos para lograr su gran sueño de estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Wilibaldo is a 22-year old man.  He is single and lives in Cañete, in the Imperial District, with his parents and siblings.  He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to improve his situation.  Unfortunately, due to his low income and his need to work to help his family, Wilibaldo has not been able to study the accounting profession like he wants to.  In his free time, he likes to play soccer with his friends and at times to cook a delicious "Carapulcra con Sopa Seca" (a meat and potato stew with noodles on the side) to share with his family. 
On his own initiative, Wilibaldo got a job working in a commercial center selling household appliances.  He works hard and with great dedication.  He works every day for about ten hours and believes that it is going well for him because of his good job performance and the friendly way he treats others. 
Wilibaldo is very grateful for the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have offered, he will be able to purchase a second-hand, two-wheeled motorbike.  It will allow him to travel the distance from his house to work while saving on commuting expenses.  Then, he will use the savings to make his greatest dream come true- to study a profession.

loans.use: with the purchase of a second-hand, two-wheeled motor bike

loans.name: Quelita

texts.es:
Quelita tiene 55 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Quelita se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles que vende en una tienda construida en su misma casa. Inicio hace 07 años por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional.Le gusta su negocio pues le permite   estar en casa y contar con la tranquilidad de un ingreso económico, además del tiempo libre que lo puede emplear en otras actividades  y el cuidado de su hogar. Esto es su quinto préstamo con Kiva, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto de 700 soles invertirá en la compra de productos comestibles al por mayor buscando los mejores para vender en su negocio.
texts.en:
Quelita is 55, married, and lives in her own home with her husband and four children. She sells food in a store that was built in her own home. She started this business seven years ago because she needed an additional income. She enjoys her business because it allows her to be at home and have the stability of an income. It also allows her to have free time for other activities and to care for her home. This is her fifth loan on Kiva. She is grateful for this financial support in fulfilling her plans. She feels comfortable with her communal bank because she knows the members and considers them to be responsible and united people.
With the requested 700 soles, she will invest in the wholesale purchase of food. She will look for the best items to sell in her business.

loans.use: to buy food, such as fruits and vegetables, wholesale.

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Efecios Group

texts.es:
DUO SOLIDARIO EFECIOS
la señora Ruth Maribel, quien tiene 31 años de edad.  Ella se dedica a la venta de mercería, jabón, pasta dental , papel higiénico, cosméticos de diferentes catálogos, pañales desechables para niño, cremas, desodorantes y más.  Su venta la tiene en el primer nivel del mercado de San Pedro Sacatepequez.  Al lado de su esposo quien la apoya incondicionalmente y contando con el amor de sus 3 hijos quienes la ayudan en el negocio se siente muy contenta.  Ella tiene el deseo en su corazón de que cada día el negocio crezca pero aun le faltan muchas cosas en su venta, ya que los clientes llegan a comprarle y le piden nuevas cosas y ella no la tiene, entonces se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para comprar las cosas que le faltan y así no quedarle mal a sus clientes, desde ya les agradese su ayuda y que Dios los bendiga.
texts.en:
DUO SOLIDARIO EFECIOS [EPHESIANS SOLIDARITY DUO]

Ruth Maribel is 31 and sells sewing supplies, soap, toothpaste, bathroom tissue, various brands of cosmetics, disposable diapers, creams, and other goods. Her store is located on the first floor of the San Pedro Sacatepequez market. Ruth Maribel has the unconditional support of her husband and the love of their three children, so she's happy. 

Ruth Maribel hopes in her heart that her business will grow by the day, but there are still many things the store doesn't offer. Customers come in to buy these items or ask for new ones that she doesn't have. Ruth Maribel therefore needs to request a loan to purchase the items missing from her inventory so she won't have to turn customers away. She is grateful for your support and asks for God's blessings on you.

loans.use: to purchase disposable diapers, creams, deodorants, and other goods for sale.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid owns a motorcycle transport business, operating from door to door. He faces a major challenge of stiff competition in his business. 

With the loan of 20,000 KES that he is requesting, he wants to pay school fees and purchase spare parts for his motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to pay school fees and purchase spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Evelyn Iliana

texts.es: Evelyn tiene 36 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos. Ella es una mujer luchadora, cuenta con 15 años de trabajar en la elaboración de tamales y oficios varios; con el firme propósito de llevar el alimento diario a su hogar. Estas actividades las aprendió de su madre que se ha dedicado a lo mismo toda la vida. Antes de aprender el oficio, ella era estudiante pero decidió mejor dedicarse a la venta de tamales, vive con su esposo e hijos, en la propiedad de su madre. A ella le proveen el elote para sus tamales en su casa; pero estos llevan un costo mas alto ya que se los llevan a domicilio, pero en época de invierno ella busca la materia prima en los alrededores por lo cual tiene que desplazarse grandes distancias y acarrearlo ella por sus propios medios. El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para la compra de recipientes, leña e ingredientes para elaborar los tamales, y a la misma vez tener capital de trabajo, porque en el verano el elote aumenta su precio y así mantener su venta y no perder los clientes. Al tener capital de trabajo la cliente, abastecerá siempre a sus clientes y tendrá siempre todo el equipo necesario para la elaboración de los tamales y los ingresos necesarios para poder mantener a su familia. Ella esta convencida de seguir trabajando fuerte día con día, para que a sus hijos no les falte nada y convertirlos en profesionales.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 36, in a relationship, and has two children. She is a fighter. She has been making tamales and doing other jobs for fifteen years with the firm goal of providing her family's daily bread. She learned her business from her mother, who has done the same all her life. Before learning this work, she was a student; but she decided it would be better to work and sell tamales. She lives with her husband and children on her mother's property.
The corn for making the tamales is brought to her home, but this carries a higher cost. However, in the wintertime, she looks for supplies in the surrounding areas, which means she has to travel large distances and carry her products herself.
This loan, which she is requesting from Fundacion Campo, is for the purchase of containers, firewood, and ingredients for making tamales; it will also provide her with working capital. In the summer the price of corn increases and this loan will allow her to maintain her sales and to avoid losing clients. 
Through having working capital, Evelyn will be able to always keep her customers in good supply, and she will always have all the necessary equipment for making tamales. She will also always have the necessary income for supporting her family. She is determined to keep working hard every day so that her children do not want for anything and can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy containers, firewood, and ingredients for making tamales, and also to have working capital.

loans.name: Feamina

texts.en:
Feamina lives outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia as one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. 

The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflowers, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest, solitary, extinct volcano. Its proximity to the dense Mount Elgon forest, as well as other neighboring forests, makes it a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Feamina is widowed and has five children. She has been farming for five years and is currently growing maize and beans on her land. She is excited to start beekeeping because “it’s an extra source of income which will upright my livelihood since I am a widow with heavy responsibilities.”

This is Feamina’s first loan with Honey Care Africa and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to build a permanent house and to buy a dairy cow. When asked about her hopes for the future, Feamina said she wants to “build a permanent house and increase my farm size since I am a widow and want my children to live a good life.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, it is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize-producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya”.

Once the maize has been harvested from their fields, many farmers grow sunflowers on their land, which is an excellent source of forage for bees. Furthermore, many farmers have started projects planting bluegum trees, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. Kitale is located close to Mount Elgon, an extinct shield volcano that extends into both Uganda and Kenya. The people from around Mount Elgon have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Fredrick is married and has three children. Both he and his wife farm, and are currently growing maize and fodder for the cattle they raise, some of which are pictured above. Fredrick is excited to become a beekeeper because the “life struggle of bees is intriguing and fascinates me. I also love honey and now have an opportunity to make some money from honey.”

Fredrick hopes to use the income generated by his hives to buy even more hives, with a view to grow his apiary to house 50 beehives. When asked about his hopes and dreams for the future, Fredrick says, “I want to be a wealthy man.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives on a farm near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. 

The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflowers, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano. Its proximity to the dense Mount Elgon forest, as well as other neighboring forests, makes it a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Christine is not married and is a new farmer, as she has been farming for one year. She is however, a very busy farmer; she is currently growing maize, bananas, sorghum, and sugarcane, and is tending to orchards and tree plantations as well. Christine likes beekeeping because “it is a labour-free business with minimal input” that “reaches the needy to uplift lives.”

This is Christine’s first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the income to invest in her honey business. In the future, Christine wants “to be a business lady in the bee industry.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in Kamukuywa, close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. 

Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway, which has fallen into a state of disrepair in recent years. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensure that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Daniel is married and has ten children. Both he and his wife have been farming for twenty years, and are currently growing coffee, bananas, maize and bluegum trees on their land. He likes beekeeping because it is a source of income that is not labour-intensive, and likes Honey Care because they manufacture modern beehives. 

This is Daniel’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to pay school fees for his children as well as pay expenses for the everyday running of his home. When asked about his hopes for the future, Daniel said, “I want to do large-scale beekeeping, and I look at it as my retirement benefit scheme.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in a farm outside of Kitale town, in Kitale county. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Once the maize has been harvested from their fields, many farmers grow sunflower on their land, which is an excellent source of forage for bees. Furthermore, many farmers have started projects planting bluegum trees, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. Kitale is located close to Mount Elgon, an extinct shield volcano that extends into both Uganda and Kenya. The people from around Mount Elgon have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Elizabeth is married, and has five children. Her husband works as a police officer while she teaches and farms their land. She and her husband have been farming for 20 years, and are currently growing maize, beans and sunflower, and are also raising cattle. She is excited to start beekeeping because it will be a good source of income for her and her family. 

This is Elizabeth’s first loan, and she plans to use the proceeds from her honey sales to buy more beehives. Her hope for the future is “to retire from the teaching profession with several other sources of income.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway, which has fallen into a state of disrepair in recent years. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Gerald is married and has five children. His wife works as a dairy farmer while he helps manage other parts of their farm. Gerald and his wife have been farming for 20 years and are currently growing maize, beans and fruit while raising chickens, sheep and cattle. Gerald is excited to start beekeeping because it will be another source of income for his small farm. He likes that Honey Care will provide professional services for his beehives. 

This is Gerald’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to educate his children and improve his crop farming. In the future, Gerald hopes to live a comfortable life with his family and save enough money to build a permanent house.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. 

The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflowers, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano. Its proximity to the dense Mount Elgon forest, as well as other neighboring forests, makes it a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Thomas is married and has nine children. Both he and his wife farm their land, and are currently growing maize, sugarcane and bananas on their plot. Thomas is very grateful to Kiva lenders for allowing him access to capital for flexible repayment of his beehives, and is excited to start beekeeping because it is a good source of income. 

This is Thomas’ first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to educate his children. Thomas’ hope and dream for the future is to “continually improve my life.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Rossio

texts.es:
Rossio es de la ciudad de Naranjito, pero como toda persona con sueños, tuvo que dejar su hogar para venir a vivir a la ciudad de Santaní a buscar su futuro por medio de una mejor educación  lo que  gracias la ayuda de sus padres estoy llevando acabo.
Siempre le gusto el área de salud, ya que podrá ayudar a las demás personas, es por eso que está siguiendo la carrera de enfermería.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas y también para poder pagar sus clases. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Rossio is from the city of Naranjito, but like all people with dreams, she had to leave her home to come to live in the city of Santani to look to her future by getting a better education.  Thanks to her parent's help, she is doing just that.

She has always had an interest in health, because she would be able to help other people.  This is why she is studying to become a nurse.

Rossio is requesting this loan to invest in her school fees and to pay for her classes.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to pay school fees and to pay for her classes at the university

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb lives in a house close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano. Its proximity to the dense Mount Elgon forest, as well as other neighboring forests, makes it a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Caleb is married, and has one child. His wife works as a shopkeeper and he farms their land. He has been farming for four years and is currently growing maize, beans and sunflower. Caleb likes working with Honey Care because “I am assured of professional services which lacks with many organizations supporting small farmers like me.” He also likes beekeeping because “Its not labor intensive and makes sure I improve the environment through tree planting.”

This is Caleb’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to buy a dairy cow for milk production. When asked about his hopes for the future, Caleb said, “I hope to be a super farmer in beekeeping [who] will one day process, pack and sell [my] own honey.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry lives outside of Kamukuywa, close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano. Its proximity to the dense Mount Elgon forest, as well as other neighboring forests, makes it a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Henry is married and has three children. Both he and his wife are farmers,and are currently growing maize and coffee on their land, as well as caring for an orchard. He is excited to become a beekeeper because in his opinion “environmental conservation goes hand in hand with beekeeping.” 

This is Henry’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to educate his children. In the future, Henry hopes to expand his beekeeping to a “large scale.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Kefa

texts.en:
Kefa lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia as one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. 

The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflowers, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano. Its proximity to the dense Mount Elgon forest, as well as other neighboring forests, makes it a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Kefa is married and has seven children. Both he and his wife engage in farming and are currently growing maize, bananas, and coffee on their land, as well as tending to an orchard. 

Kefa is an experienced beekeeper, and is excited to upgrade his traditional log hives to modern Langstroth beehives. He thinks beekeeping is a good business because honey is medicinal and the bees pollinate his orchard. 

This is Kefa’s first loan with Honey Care Africa and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to educate his children. In the future, Kefa hopes to educate his children through university, so that they can “live a meaningful life.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard lives close to Kamukuywa, near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and, at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. 

The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Once the maize has been harvested from their fields, many farmers grow sunflowers on their land, which is an excellent source of forage for bees. Furthermore, many farmers have started projects planting blue gum trees, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. 

Kitale is located close to Mount Elgon, an extinct shield volcano that extends into both Uganda and Kenya. The people from around Mount Elgon have been beekeeping for centuries and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Richard is married and has three children. Both he and his wife engage in farming and are currently growing maize on their land. He is excited to start beekeeping because “it is not costly to run and is economical in terms of labor.” 

This is Richard’s first loan and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives for “personal development as well as saving for my children's education.” In the future, Richard hopes to “invest to expand my business as well as seeing that I am well-educated, as well as my children.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary lives close to Kamukuywa, outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. 

Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway, which has fallen into a state of disrepair in recent years. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Rosemary is married and has nine children. Her husband works as a carpenter, while she engages in projects on their land. She has been farming for 20 years and is currently growing maize and beans, as well as coffee. She is excited to start beekeeping because "honey is medicinal and will go a long way to improve my life through its income."

This is Rosemary's first loan with Honey Care Africa and she plans to use the additional income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 47 años, es madre soltera y  vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos. Lidia se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir para damas caballeros y niños. Pero también elabora con frecuencia algunas prendas que personalmente diseña de manera creatividad las cuales vende rápidamente. Se dedica a esta actividad más de 15 años, tuvo que descansarse por algunos meses por cuestiones de salud, pero ahora lo hace con muchas más ganas que antes.
