Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede plasmar en un prenda el diseño en que se inspira, la facilidad que tiene de crear algo nuevo la coloca como una de las mejores costureras de la ciudad; espera pronto construir un taller de costura y construir un espacio únicamente destinado a la venta de sus creaciones. Este será su tercer préstamo con Kiva, agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto de S. / 1000 comprará materiales de costura como telas, hilos, elásticos, encajes y licra.
texts.en:
Lidia is 47 years old. She is a single mother and lives in her own home with her three children. Lidia works making clothing items for men, women, and children, but she also often personally designs some of the clothing items she makes and her creations sell quickly. She has been working in this business for over fifteen years. She had to take a few months off because of health problems, but now she is back to work and has much more enthusiasm than before. What she likes about her work is that she can reflect her inspiration in an item of clothing. Her knack for creating new things has made her one of the best seamstresses in the city. She hopes to build a sewing shop soon and also build a space to showcase and sell her own creations exclusively. 

This will be her third loan through Kiva. She appreciates the opportunity and trust they have given her in order to receive this loan. On the other hand, she promises to comply with her payment terms in a timely manner. She will use the 1,000 PEN amount to purchase sewing materials like fabric, thread, elastic bands, lace, and lycra.

loans.use: to buy materials like fabric, thread, and elastic bands for her dressmaking business.

loans.name: Aguatería Group

texts.es:
El señor  Celso tiene 52 años, es de profesión Ingeniero Agrónomo, está casado con la Sra. Ada, tiene 4 hijos.
Es dueño en conjunto con su esposa de una aguateria, y cuenta que desde 1991que provee de agua al vecindario. Cuenta que todo surgió debido a la necesidad que tenían todos los vecinos en aquella epoca para acceder al agua potable y justamente por ello el Sr Celso decidió realizar la excavación  de un pozo artesiano  para su uso particular, pero comenta que en ese tiempo la necesidad que tenían sus vecinos de acceder al agua potable eran muy grande que le motivo para pasarles la mano y decidió arriesgarse y abrió su aguateria  y empezó a expandir sus instalaciones a sus vecinos mas cercanos, coloco una boca se salida de agua en la esquina de su casa donde se acercaban carritos tirados a caballos con tambores para poder hacer llegar el  liquido vital a las zonas mas lejanas.
Poco a poco el el sr Celso mediante la adquisición  de un credito  hipotecario fue ampliando sus instalaciones para poder proveer a mas gente de agua potable y a la vez iba creciendo su negocio que hoy en dia cuenta con 1292 usuarios todos registrados y controlados con medidores de primera calidad, hoy en día su aguateria esta dotada de 6 pozos artesianos con una profundidad de 145 metros c/u un tanque de agua subterráneo  con capacidad de 106.000 litros el cual funciona como reserva y 3 tanques de 35.000 lts los cuales realizan el trabajo diario de abastecer a la comunidad, la aguatería esta totalmente automatizada en lo que se refiere a la carga de tanque y sistema de distribución.
El sr Celso es una persona reconocida en la zona ya que siempre se caracterizo por la lucha que realizo para poder llevar adelante su actual comunidad, hay mucha obras que se le atribuyen al cliente de referencia como la expansión  eléctrica  de mas de 1700mts de cableado, la construcción  de una escuela y las mejoras de calles mediante la construcción  de empedrados.
Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compre de un vehículo para poder utilizarlo en la aguatería como medio de reparto de agua y también para utilizarlo en momentos de emergencia dentro de la aguatería. Esta muy agradecido por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Celso is 52 years old and is an agricultural engineer by profession. He is married to Ada and has 4 children.

He and his wife are owners of a water supply business that he says has provided water to the neighborhood since 1991. He says it all came about because in those days everyone in the neighborhood had a need to obtain access to drinking water. For this same reason, Celso decided to dig an artesian well for his own personal use. However, he says that at the time, the need that his neighbors had to access drinking water was so great that he was motivated to lend them a hand. He decided to take a risk and opened his water supply business. He began expanding his facilities to his closest neighbors. He put in a water outlet at the corner of his house where horse-drawn carts approached with drums to transport the vital liquid to the most distant regions.

By taking out a mortgage loan, Celso expanded his facilities little by little to be able to provide drinking water to more people. At the same time, his business grew and today he has 1292 users, all registered y controlled by high-quality meters. Today his water supply facility is equipped with 6 artesian wells - each with a depth of 145 meters, an underground water tank with a capacity of 106,000 liters that functions as a reserve and three 35,000-liter tanks that supply the community on a daily basis. The water supply facility is completely automated in terms of tank loading and the distribution system.

Celso is a well-recognized person in the region, always characterized by the struggle he went through to further his community. There are many projects attributed to him, such as an electrical extension of more than 1700 meters of wiring, the construction of a school and improvements made to roads by paving them.

He is requesting this loan to purchase a vehicle to use in his water supply business as a means to distribute the water and to use in times of emergency at the facility. He is very grateful to receive this opportunity; it will be of great assistance.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle to use in water supply business.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano. Its proximity to the dense Mount Elgon forest, as well as other neighboring forests, makes it a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Paul is married, and has four children. His wife works as a businesswoman, while Paul farms their land. He has been farming for ten years, and is currently growing maize, beans and coffee, as well as raising cattle. He is excited to start beekeeping because, “it is easy to keep bees and it only [requires] capital investment in hives and no other costs.”

This is Paul’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to help him pay his children’s school fees. Paul’s hope for the future is to be able to “invest heavily in agricultural projects.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es de la ciudad de Ybycui, es una mujer que sigue queriendo crecer, es por eso que sigue estudiando. Esta haciendo un profesorado en ciencias sociales.
Gloria siempre fue consciente que la única forma de salir adelante es por medio de la educación, y es justamente en miras a poder convertirse en una gran profesional que está estudiando y quiere seguir con sus metas.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad lo que le será de gran ayuda para poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Gloria is from Ybycui.  She is a woman who wants to keep growing, which is why she is continuing her studies.  She is earning a degree in Social Sciences. 
Gloria has always been aware that the only way to get ahead is through education.  She is just on the verge of becoming a great professional, and she wants to continue with her goals. 
Gloria is requesting this loan to be able to invest in paying her university fees.  It will be a great help to her and allow her to keep studying.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson tuvo que venir a la ciudad de Santaní en busca de mejores oportunidades para poder estudiar y cumplir con su sueño de ser un profesional.
Desde muy pequeño soñó con ser un Abogado, que de hecho este camino de serlo, en primer lugar para mejorar la calidad de vida de mi familia y la suya. Está estudiando arduamente por sobresalir y el día de mañana ser útil no solo a si mismo sino también a los demás.
Wilson solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en pagar sus clases y también para comprar materiales de la universidad, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Wilson had to come to the city of Santaní in search of better schooling opportunities and to reach his dream of becoming a professional.  Since he was very young he’s dreamed with becoming an attorney who he’s in fact on the road to becoming in the first place to improve his and his family’s quality of life.  He’s studying hard to stand out and in future be useful not only to himself but also to others.

Wilson’s asking for this loan to pay for his courses and also to buy university supplies; this will be of great help to him.

loans.use: to pay tuition and to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Ramona es una persona con muchas ansias de crecer y ser una excelente profesional el día de mañana. 
Cuenta que está estudiando la especialización en Criminalista y Peritaje  Forense, lo cual le ayudará a aumentar sus conocimientos, lo cual es muy importante.
Cuenta que en un tiempo se ve ejerciendo su profesión, creciendo cada día como persona ayudando a la sociedad. Vive en casa de sus padres, que con mucho esfuerzo la han ayudado.
 Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en  sus gastos de titulación, ya que tiene muchas gestiones y pagos que tiene que hacer para poder recibir su titulo. Está contenta por esta ayuda que recibe.
texts.en:
Ramona is a person who very much wants to grow and to become an excellent professional in future.  She relates that she’s studying Criminology and Forensics which will help her increase her knowledge which is very important.  

She relates that she sees herself practicing her profession in time growing as a person every day helping society.  She lives in her parents’ house; they have helped her with much effort.

She requests this loan to pay for her degree fees because there are several steps to take and fees to pay in order to get her degree.  She’s happy for this help she’s getting.

loans.use: to pay degree fees.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Don Carlos, es un señor trabajador quien busca la manera de cómo sacar adelante a sus hijos y esposa quien continua haciendo tortillas y el con el trabajo de albañilería y elaboración de aparatos soldados de manera artesanal, los cuales vende. Todo esto para apoyar a sus hijos  con la educación que es la base fundamental para la familia. Para poder continuar con su labor solicita el crédito para comprar materiales como pinturas en spray, alambre de aluminio, alambre eléctrico entre otros de su necesidad.
texts.en: Carlos is a hardworking man who is looking for a way to support his children and his wife, who continues to make tortillas.  He works doing masonry and making handmade welded applicances to sell.  They are doing all of this to support their children in their education, which is the foundation of their family.  In order to continue with his work, he is requesting a loan to buy materials such as spray paint, aluminum wire, electrical wire and other things as needed.

loans.use: To buy materials such as spray paint, aluminum wire, electrical wire and other things as needed,

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola es de la ciudad de Pilar, está estudiando la carrera de Contabilidad pública, con la cual quiere poder ayudar a su familia y salir adelante.
Ella cuenta que ellos le inspiran a poder salir adelante y crecer. En unos años se ve terminando la carrera y ayudando a las personas por medio de los conocimientos que ha adquirido. En unos años se ve haciendo otros cursos de capacitación para seguir creciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de la universidad. Agradece por esta oportunidad que ella está recibiendo, ya que por medio de esto podrá seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Paola is from the city of Pilar.  She’s studying a Public Accounting career that she wants to use to be able to help her family and to get ahead.  She relates that they inspire her to get ahead and to grow.

She sees herself a few years from now having finished her career helping people by means of the knowledge she’s acquired.  In a few years she sees herself taking additional courses to continue growing. 

She requests this loan to pay university tuition fees.  She’s grateful for this opportunity she’s getting because by mean of this she will be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una persona muy luchadora, que trabaja y estudia, quiere salir adelante y ser una profesional de mucho éxito que pueda ayudar a las demás personas.
Ella cuenta que como estudiante es muy buena alumna, también es  una hija ejemplar y que sus papas siempre la han ayudado a poder seguir con sus sueños.
Cristina solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Cristina is a very tenacious person who works and studies.  She wants to get ahead and to become a very successful professional who is able to help other people.

She relates that she’s a very good student with regard to her studies and she’s also an exemplary daughter and that her parents have always helped her to follow her dreams.

Cristina requests this loan to pay her university tuition fees in order to be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
La Sra. Nilda es jubilada en la Docencia Primaria, es Profesora de Guarani, Matemáticas, Psicología, y ahora está estudiando para enseñar en la Universidad,  tiene 4 hijas todas ellas ya casadas y con hijos, las cuales crio con mucho esfuerzo y lucha.
Su aspiración es la de seguir enseñando a muchas personas y la inspiración es definitivamente su familia y el de superarse cada día. Sabe que la edad no es obstáculo para aprender y es por eso que sigue estudiando.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de las clases, para que de esa forma pueda cubrir sus gastos. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Nilda is a retired primary school teacher; she taught Guaraní, Mathematics and Psychology and now is studying to be able to teach in the university.  She has four daughters, all married with children, who she raised with much effort and struggle.

Her hope is to continue teaching many people and her family is definitely her inspiration to continue improving every day.  She knows that age is no obstacle to learning and this is why she continues studying.

She requests this loan to pay tuition fees for her courses so that she can cover her expenses.  She is grateful for this opportunity she’s getting.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees.

loans.name: Carlos Rene

texts.es:
Carlos, está acompañado y disfruta de dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 6 y 8 años, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. El, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos tales como: maíz y frijol, asimismo a cultivar hortalizas de chile y tomate, dicha actividad la realiza desde 10 años, oficio que lo aprendió por organizaciones nacionales, lo  desempeña todos los días de 6:00am a 6:00pm y hasta el momento no presenta ninguna dificultad.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a obtener los materiales agrícolas indicados  y asi obtener  una excelente cosecha.
Su sueño es terminar de estudiar la educación media y que no les falte la alimentación a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is in a relationship and has two wonderful children ages 6 and 8. He does not have any family members abroad. He cultivates basic staples such as corn and beans. He also cultivates vegetables such as chilis and tomatoes. He has done this work for ten years, and learned it from national organizations. He works every day from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm, and he has not had any difficulties so far.
This loan will allow him to buy the necessary agricultural supplies such as: manure, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and fungicides. This investment will allow him to obtain these agricultural supplies and therefore obtain an excellent harvest.
His dream is to complete his secondary education and for his family to never lack the necessities.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and fungicides, among other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to take a cooking class.

loans.name: Genovo

texts.es: Genovo es un productor de café orgánico y durante la cosecha pasada resembro parte de su finca con la ayuda del crédito que obtuvo en Kiva. Actualmente su producción por cosecha es de 10 toneladas pero dentro de dos años esta podría aumentar a 15 toneladas debido a las plantas que sembró. Parte de las ganancias obtenidas en esta cosecha Genovo y su esposa las invirtieron en un terreno el cual ocuparán para producir café. Para la siguiente cosecha Genovo necesita un nuevo crédito para realizar labores de limpieza en sus parcelas y comprar abono, de esta manera logrará llegar a su meta de 15 toneladas.
texts.en: Genovo grows organic coffee and during the previous planting season he replanted part of his farm with help from the Kiva loan he got.  His current crop yield is ten tons but in two years it might grow up to 15 tons thanks to the plants he planted.  Genovo and his wife invested part of the profits earned from this harvest to buy land that they’ll use to produce coffee.  Genovo needs a new loan for the next harvest in order to do the weeding chores on his parcels and to buy manure and in this way reach his 15-ton goal.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to weed his land.

loans.name: Héctor Alejandro

texts.es: Con un crédito de Kiva Héctor logró sembrar planta nueva de café, ya que hace más de un año gran parte de su finca se vio afectada por las intensas lluvias. La nueva planta que sembró estará dando frutos en dos años más y para que se mantenga fuerte durante ese lapso Héctor necesita comprar fertilizante orgánico. Él y su familia están muy agradecidos con Kiva ya que en las financieras de su localidad es difícil obtener un crédito y son muchos trámites los que hay que hacer para tener acceso al financiamiento.
texts.en: With a Kiva loan Hector was able to plant a new crop of coffee plants, following more than a year that a large portion of his land was effected by intense rains. The new crop that he planted will bear fruit in two more years, and, in order to ensure that the crop remains strong during this time, Hector needs to purchase organic fertilizer. He and his family are very grateful to Kiva as it can be difficult in their community to secure a loan from financial institutions and there are many steps that must be taken in order to have access to financing.

loans.use: purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ilucion Group

texts.es:
"La Ilución" es el nombre de un grupo conformado por 15 personas, ellos decidieron este nombre a su grupo porque tienen la ilusión de que por medio de este crédito sus negocios van a prosperar y poder dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Los integrantes del grupo son:

Eunice-Venta de Zapatos
Filiberto-Servicio de Taxi
María Teresa-Venta de cosméticos
Claudia Estela –Venta de Frutas y verduras
Rosa-Venta de Ropa
Guadalupe-Repostería
Gladis-Venta de Bisutería
Rebeca-Venta de Ropa
Santa-venta de bisutería
María Lorenza-Venta de perfumes
Adela-Venta de Zapatos
Cristian-Venta de ropa
Guillermina- Carnicería
María de Jesús-Venta de Ropa
Reyna-venta de ropa

Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en Tierra Blanca que se caracteriza por sus fuertes calores en verano y sus principales actividades  económicas son el comercio y ganadería.

Guadalupe o Lupe como la llaman sus amigos tiene la edad de 30 años, solo estudio la preparatorio, está casada con el señor Jorge como maestro. Ellos tienen 2 hijos, Luis Roberto de 10 años y Alex de 7 años que asisten a la primaria.

Lupe platica que se dedica a la repostería y panadería desde hace ya algunos años. Ella decidió iniciar con esta actividad porque siempre le ha gustado cocinar pero más en particular la elaboración de postres. Su gusto por esta actividad surgió de la necesidad que sentía por preparar a sus hijos comida saludable, después pensó que sería una buena manera de ganar su propio dinero vendiendo postres y realizando pasteles.

Ella poco a poco ha ganado buenas clientes, sus formas de venta es casa por casa y por pedidos. Un día antes sale a ofrecer y al día siguiente que prepara sus postres sale a entregar. También se encarga de hacer bocadillos para fiestas.

Lupe platica que en tiempos de frio tiene más ventas pero siempre busca la manera de que sus ventas se mantengan y en tiempo de calor elaborar Gelatinas que se venden muy bien.

Lo que más le gusta de su actividad además de ganar su propio dinero es que en la repostería refleja  lo mejor de ella y le pone mucho amor y dedicación a cada bocadillo o postre que prepara.

Un crédito de Kiva y VisionFund le ayudara a comprar harina, azúcar, huevos, gelatinas, desechables, chantillí, azúcar glass y recipientes.

A futuro tiene planeado estudiar la carrera de chef y hacer su negocio más grande, establecerse en un local y con la ayuda de sus hijos brindar al servicio de banquetes y hacer de su actividad un negocio familiar.

Ella agradece el apoyo de VisionFund ya que con estos préstamos ha podido hacer progresar su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
La Ilución [Hope] Communal Bank has 15 members.  They chose this name for their group because they hope their businesses will prosper with this loan and they can give their families a better quality of life.  This group is located in Tierra Blanca, known for its very hot summers and for commerce and ranching, its main economic activities.

The members of the group are Eunice, shoe sales; Filiberto, taxi service; María Teresa, cosmetics sales; Claudia Estela, fruit and vegetable sales; Rosa, clothing sales; Guadalupe, pastry making; Gladis, costume jewelry sales; Rebeca, clothing sales; Santa, costume jewelry sales; María Lorenza, perfume sales; Adela, shoe sales; Cristián, clothing sales; Guillermina, butcher shop; María de Jesús, clothing sales; and Reyna, clothing sales.

Guadalupe, or Lupe as she's known to her friends, is 30 years old.  She only went to high school.  She's married to Jorge, a teacher.  They have two children who attend elementary school, Luis Roberto, 10, and Alex, 7.

Lupe says she has earned a living making pastry and baking for several years now.  She decided to start this work because she has always liked to cook and, especially, make desserts.  Her taste for this activity came from her need to make healthy food for her children.  Then she thought selling desserts and making pastry would be a good way to earn her own money.

Little by little she has attracted good customers.  She sells door-to-door and on order.  One day she goes out to offer her products and the next day she makes the pastries to deliver.  She also makes sandwiches for parties.  Lupe says she has more sales in the cold weather, but she's always looking for ways to keep her sales stable.  In the hot weather gelatin sells very well.

What she likes most about her job in addition to earning her own money is that making pastry reflects the best of what she is, and she puts a lot of love and effort into each sandwich or pastry she makes.

A loan from Kiva and VisionFund will help her buy flour, sugar, eggs, gelatin, disposable supplies, Chantilly cream, powdered sugar, and containers.

In the future she plans to study to be a chef, expand her business, set herself up in a place, and provide banquet services with her children to make her job a family business.

She's grateful for the support of VisionFund because she has been able to make progress with her business and improve her quality of life with these loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make pastry

loans.name: Stephene

texts.en:
Stephene lives near Kamukuywa, close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway, which has fallen into a state of disrepair in recent years. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Stephene is married, and has four children. His wife works as a teacher, while he engages in projects on their land. He is currently growing maize and bananas, as well as tending to a bluegum tree plantation. Stephene is excited about becoming a beekeeper because his bees will give him an additional income source from his farm. 

This is Stephene’s first loan, and he plans to use the income from his hives to educate his children and expand his number of the hives. In the future, Stephene wants “to be a farmer who will be teaching other farmers on beekeeping.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher lives in a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya and, at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Once the maize has been harvested from the fields, many farmers grow sunflowers on their land, which is an excellent source of forage for bees. Furthermore, many farmers have started projects planting bluegum trees, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. Kitale is located close to Mount Elgon, an extinct shield volcano that extends into both Uganda and Kenya. The people from around Mount Elgon have been beekeeping for centuries and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Christopher is married and has ten children. Both he and his wife are farmers and they are currently growing coffee, avocados, maize, and beans on their land as well as managing a dairy farming project. Christopher is excited to become a beekeeper because the bees will help pollinate his crops and the money from his honey will help him with other projects on his farm. 

This is Christopher’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the income to help him educate his children to higher levels. In the future, his hope is to “expand bee-keeping in my farm to ensure I am successful in it.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. 

Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway, which has fallen into a state of disrepair in recent years. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Samson is married and has ten children. His wife works as a teacher, while Samson engages in projects around their land. He has been farming for 40 years and is currently growing maize and sunflower crops, as well as undertaking dairy farming. Samson is excited to start beekeeping because the bees will pollinate his crops, giving him increased yields and improved quality of produce. 

This is Samson’s first loan and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to educate his children. In the future, Samson’s dream is “to live a better life and have several sources of income from my farm.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives close to Kamukuywa, near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity to one another. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest, solitary, extinct volcano. Kitale's proximity to the dense Mount Elgon forest, as well as other neighboring forests, makes it a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Rose is married and has seven children. Her husband works as a teacher while she engages in projects on their land. She has been farming for twenty four years, and is currently growing sugarcane, maize, and bananas. Rose is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper because honey “is good food for my children and it is also an income source.”

This is Rose’s first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to help pay for her children’s education. When asked about her hopes and dreams for the future, Rose said “I want to improve my life through beekeeping.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity to one another. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest, solitary, extinct volcano. Kitale's proximity to the dense Mount Elgon forest, as well as other neighboring forests, makes it a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Reuben is married and has six children. Both him and his wife farm and are currently growing maize and bananas, as well as tending to a tree plantation and rearing livestock. Reuben is excited to become a beekeeper because “honey is a food supplement and good for the family, as well as a source of income generation.”

This is Reuben’s first loan and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to help pay his children’s school fees. Reuben’s hope for the future is to improve the living standard of his entire family.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyn lives in a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize-producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Once the maize has been harvested from their fields, many farmers grow sunflowers on their land, which is an excellent source of forage for bees. Furthermore, many farmers have started projects planting bluegum trees, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. Kitale is located close to Mount Elgon, an extinct shield volcano that extends into both Uganda and Kenya. The people from around Mount Elgon have been beekeeping for centuries and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Roselyn is married and has two children. Her husband works as a beekeeper around Kakamega while she engages in projects on their land. She is currently growing maize, millet, sugarcane, and vegetables and she also tends to cattle and chicken. Roselyn is excited to start beekeeping because it is a stress-free occupation that leaves her time to tend to her farm. 

This is Roselyn’s first loan and she is planning to use her beehives as a sort of savings fund for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias lives in a farm outside of Kitale town. 

Elias is married, and has five children. His wife works as a shopkeeper, while he farms their land. He has been farming for sixteen years, and is currently growing maize, beans and sunflowers. Elias is excited to start beekeeping because, “I will get pollination in my farm to increase yield and quality of my crops.”

This is Elias’ first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives “for the purposes of school fees. I am creating an education fund for my children in [the form of] bee hives.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize-producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Once the maize has been harvested from their fields, many farmers grow sunflowers on their land, which is an excellent source of forage for bees. Furthermore, many farmers have started projects planting blue gum trees, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. Kitale is located close to Mount Elgon, an extinct shield volcano that extends into both Uganda and Kenya. The people from around Mount Elgon have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Paul is married, and has one child. His wife works as a lab technician at a local high school, while he farms their land. Paul is currently rearing cattle, and growing crops including maize, beans and sunflowers. He is excited to start beekeeping because it is “a stress free income generation activity which does not require my daily involvement, and [provides] pollination for my crops.”

Paul hopes to use the income generated by his beehives to provide an education for his child. In the future, Paul’s dream is to “do beekeeping at a large scale.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert lives close to Kamukuywa, near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway, which has fallen into a state of disrepair in recent years. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensure that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Robert is married, and has two children. His wife works as an administrator for local government, while Robert engages in projects on their land. He has been farming for ten years, and is currently growing sugarcane, maize and bananas, as well as tending to a tree plantation. Robert is excited to learn more about bees, and likes beekeeping because it is a source of income that also provides honey for consumption. 

This is Robert’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives for domestic use, as well as to help pay his children’s school fees. Robert’s dream for the future is to expand his apiary and do “large scale beekeeping.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household products like wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business. 

Saumu is requesting 15,000 KES to boost her kiosk by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Pedro Francisco

texts.es:
Pedro,  porque requiere de un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de más capital de trabajo para seguir en su actividad; este le permitirá comprar repuestos que necesita en  la imprenta.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar los ingresos, es por ello que las condiciones económicas han mejorado  y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen.
texts.en:
Pedro, needs a new loan because of the need for more working capital in order to continue in his work. This will allow him to buy spare parts he needs for the printing press.

His previous loan helped him to improve his income, which is why his financial condition has improved and the family circumstances maintained.

loans.use: to buy spare parts that are needed for his printing press

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after Kenya's independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflowers, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary, extinct volcano. Its proximity to the dense Mount Elgon forest, as well as other neighboring forests, makes it a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Samuel is married, and has five children. His wife works as a shopkeeper, while he tends to their farm. He has been farming for twelve years, and is currently growing sugarcane and maize crops. He is excited to become a beekeeper because the money generated by his hives will be a welcome extra source of income for him and his family. 

This is Samuel’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the income generated by his hives to help educate his children and invest in his maize and sunflower production. His hope for the future is to be “successful in life through educating my children and [providing] good medical care for my family.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Fatuma dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 15,000, she wants to increase her stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: La cosecha pasada Hugo renovó parte de su cultivo de café gracias a un crédito que obtuvo de Kiva. Con este crédito le fue posible comprar planta de café y fertilizante orgánico e incluso utilizó lo restante del crédito para invertir en su cultivo de caña de azúcar. Si todo sale conforme a lo planeado en un lapso de dos años él estará cosechando los primeros frutos de este trabajo que ha venido realizando. Para esta nueva cosecha Hugo quiere continuar renovando otras partes de su cafetal así como fertilizar lo que ya tiene sembrado. Para poder hacer todo esto necesita nuevamente de un crédito el cual pagará al final de la cosecha que es cuando cuenta con más recursos.
texts.en:
The last harvest Hugo renewed part of his coffee cultivation thanks to a loan he obtained through Kiva.

With this loan it was possible to buy coffee plants and organic fertilizer and with the rest of the loan he was able to invest growing sugar cane. If all goes according to plan over a two year time period he will be harvesting the first fruit of this work that has been done.

For this new crop Hugo wants to continue renewing other parts of his coffee farm and fertilize what he has planted. In order to do this he needs a new loan which he will pay at the end of the harvest when there are more resources.

loans.use: to renew cultivation of his coffee farm and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Senah

texts.en:
Senah lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize-producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Once the maize has been harvested from their fields, many farmers grow sunflowers on their land, which is an excellent source of forage for bees. Furthermore, many farmers have started projects planting blue gum trees, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. Kitale is located close to Mount Elgon, an extinct shield volcano that extends into both Uganda and Kenya. The people from around Mount Elgon have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Senah is widowed, and has six children. She has been farming for seven years, and is currently growing maize and coffee on her land. Senah is excited to start beekeeping because she loves honey: she believes it is “a good food and it is medicinal.”

This is Senah’s first loan with Honey Care, and she plans on using the income generated by her beehives to educate her children. In the future, Senah’s dream is “to live a comfortable life.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward lives in Kamukuywa, close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflowers, sugarcane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano. Its proximity to the dense Mount Elgon forest, as well as other neighboring forests, makes it a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Edward is married and has four children. He is currently farming sugarcane and maize, and also raises cattle and prepares wood blocks for sale. Edward is excited to start beekeeping for many reasons. He said, ”Beekeeping is easy and does not require a lot of labour. Bees also help in pollination. Honey is medicinal too.”

This is Edward’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to help save for his children’s education. In the future, Edward hopes to expand apiculture and run it as a business to help his family progress.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles lives on a farm near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway, which has fallen into a state of disrepair in recent years. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensure that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 
 
Charles is married and has fifteen children. Both he and his wife are farmers, and are currently growing maize, beans, potatoes and bananas on their land. They are also raising poultry on the side. Charles is excited to start beekeeping because it will be a good income source for his family, and also wants to work with Honey Care because he says, "they have brought development near us in terms of beekeeping.” 

This is Charles’ first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to pay his children’s school fees. In the future, Charles hopes to improve the quality of his life and his family’s life to better standards.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Mtama

texts.en:
Mtama operates a cafe, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other cafe operators in her business.
 
With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, rice and wheat flour for food preparation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of maize flour, rice and wheat flour for food preparation.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama has operated a retail shop business and motorcycle transport business. His potential customers are market dwellers and neighbors. He faces a major challenge of competition from other motorcycle operators.

With the Kshs 50,000, he wants to purchase 5 sacks of beans, 50 litres of cooking oil, 4 bundles of wheat flour, 3 bags of rice and spare parts for the motorcycle business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business and he is thankful for the support.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sacks of beans, 50 litres of cooking oil, 4 bundles of wheat flour, 3 bags of rice and spare parts for the motorcycle business

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business. 

Mesalimu is requesting Kshs 50,000 to boost her kiosk, purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama is a hardworking woman who tries hard to meet the needs of her family. She runs a charcoal selling business and she appreciates the support of the previous Kiva loan which helped her to boost her business. Here again, she comes to you asking for a loan of KES 25,000 to buy 6 sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Mwanauru

texts.en:
Mwanauru is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business, and she dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans.

loans.name: Chidunga

texts.en:
Chidunga is a married man with children, all of whom attend school. He lives in his own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan that he is requesting of Kshs 50,000, he wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and wheat for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and wheat for sale.

loans.name: Matano

texts.en:
Matano is a married man with 8 children. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, he has operated a goat meat business, selling goats from home to butcher operators. He cites seasonality as his major challenge in the business. 

He is requesting a loan for Kshs 25,000 to help him to purchase 6 goats for sale to earn a living. He dreams of having a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase 6 goats for sale to earn a living.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan has operated a carpentry shop business. He cites seasonality as his major challenge in the business. 

He is requesting a loan for Kshs 50,000 to buy more timber for the carpentry business. He dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more timber for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a married man with one kid. He lives at his own house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food. 

He has operated a fish-selling business, which has been operational for the last 3 years. With the Kshs 30,000 loan, he wants to purchase sacks of dry fish for resale. He dreams of expanding and establishing a depot for fish selling in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of dry fish for resale.

loans.name: Bertha Alis

texts.es:
Bertha, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para fortalecer su negocio y crecer más económicamente; este le ayudara a comprar tomates, aguacates, maíz, frijoles, frutas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le fue de mucha ayuda, ya que obtuvo mejores ganancias y mejoro las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
Bertha has found the need of opting for a new loan because she requires more working capital to strengthen her business to grow financially. This will help her buy tomatoes, avocados, corn, beans, fruit, and more.

Her last loan helped her a lot as she obtained higher profits and improved her family circumstances.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, avocados, corn, beans, fruit, and more items

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Con el crédito que obtuvo el año pasado por parte de Kiva Hugo pudo comprar abono, limpiar su terreno e invertir en su vivero de planta de café. Otra parte del crédito la invirtió en otros cultivos que produce como maíz y frijol. Para la siguiente cosecha Hugo necesita adquirir fertilizantes para su terreno. Hugo nos platicó que hace dos años resembró parte de su terreno y para esta cosecha estarán dando sus primeros frutos.
texts.en: With the loan that he obtained from Kiva last year, Hugo was able to purchase organic fertilizer, clear his land, and invest in his coffee nursery.  He invested the other part of the loan in other crops that he produces such as corn and beans.  For the next harvest, Hugo needs to acquire fertilizer for his land.  Hugo told us that he re-seeded part of his land two years ago and for this harvest, the plants will be bearing their first fruit.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
This is Corazon, 32, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Marlon, a supervisor, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Corazon operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Corazon dreams to expand her business and hopes that her children will finish their schooling.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Loida works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Loida is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her tricycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Loida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her tricycle

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. Melanie is married and has a banana vending business in the Philippines.

Melanie requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for 3 years now and also earns additional income from vending vegetables and fruits.

She successfully paid back the previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her banana and vegetable vending business.

In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is 48 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Merlie is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Merlie has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from charcoal and rice vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Metria

texts.en:
Metria is 54 years old and married with six children.

Metria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, sugar, shampoo, vinegar, soy sauce, oil, soap, groceries, etc.

Metria has borrowed and paid back 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Metria aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, sugar, shampoo, vinegar, soysauce, oil, soap, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and is married with seven children. With four children currently in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, biscuits, candies, juice, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nalina

texts.en:
Nalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Nalina has been in this business for 3 years. She earns more income from farming rice.

Nalina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her business making dried fish.

Sarah has been in this business for seven years. She earns more income from fish vending.

Sarah has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight years, she has operated a retail shop business selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business. 

She is requesting for Kshs 15,000 to boost her kiosk, purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman; she has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mariam has operated a coconut selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she sells lesos (women's wrap clothing). She faces stiff competition from other coconut sellers in her business.
 
With the Kshs 80,000, she wants to purchase bundles of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a married man with kids. He lives in his own house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food. 

He operates a goat meat selling business, which has been operational for the last 2 years. With the Kshs 15,000 loan, he wants to purchase 4 more goats for sale, and he dreams of expanding and establishing his own premises for selling his goats in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 4 more goats for sale

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: En  la cosecha pasada Alejandro  resembró parte de su finca gracias al crédito obtenido por parte de Kiva. Con estos trabajos dentro de tres años su cosecha aumentará y para que esto sea posible requiere de un nuevo crédito pues necesita comprar fertilizante  para que las nuevas plantas crezcan y en poco tiempo ya estén produciendo café de primera calidad.
texts.en: Thanks to the loan he obtained from Kiva, Alejandro re-seeded part of his farm at the last harvest.  With these efforts, his crops will grow within three years.  For this to be possible, he needs a new loan to purchase fertilizer so that the new plants grow and in a short time, produce premium coffee.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to be able to increase production at the next harvest.

loans.name: Agricultores De Chuisajcab 2 Group

texts.es:
Manuel es el representante del Grupo de Agricultores Chuisajcab 2  (de suéter azul marino el primero que se encuentra en la parte de abajo del lado derecho de la fotografía) es un  hombre casado de 35 años de edad, vive junto a sus 4 hijos, 3 hombres y 1 mujer en el Caserío Chuicascab, Aldea Tzucubal  Nahualá. 
El  es un hombre trabajador, comenta que el se dedica a la siembra de maíz  a unos metros de su vivienda desde hace 20 años. Eligió este tipo de actividad porque desde pequeño empezó a trabajar junto a sus padres,  es como de esta manera fue adquiriendo experiencia. 
A través de lo que realiza puede alimentar a su familia durante un año y comercializarlo en el mercado local. Esta labor le genera ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le ayudan a cubrir los gastos de su familia.
Los demás integrantes del grupo utilizaran la otra parte del crédito para la siembra  de maíz, con el  propósito de mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de abono orgánico para el cultivo de maíz.
Su sueño es comprar un terreno para ampliar su cultivo y generar más ganancias que le permitirán mejorar la  calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Manuel is the representative for the Chuisajcab 2 farmers Group (he is the one wearing a navy blue jumper at the bottom right of the photo).  He is a married man who lives with his 4 children (3 sons and 1 daughter) in Chuicascab village, in the town of Tzucubal Nahualá.  He is a hardworking man who says that he has been growing corn for 20 years on land just metres from his home.  He chose this line of work because he began doing it with his parents when he was still small and gradually gained experience.  With what he grows, he can feed his family for a year and sell some at the local market.  The reasonable income and profits he makes from his work help him to cover the household expenses.  The other members of the group will use the rest of the loan to grow corn, with the aim of improving their families' living conditions.  The loan will be used to buy organic manure for Manuel's corn crop.  His dream is to buy a plot of land to expand his increase his crops and generate higher profits so he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic manure for corn crops

loans.name: Nory

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nory works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Nory is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish for her dried fish making business.

Nory has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish for her business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 58 years old, married, and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for seven years, and she earns additional income by raising pigs.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more items to sell at her store, like biscuits, snack foods, candies, and soft drinks. Margarita has borrowed and repaid seven previous loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell at her store, like biscuits, snack foods, candies, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sarapia

texts.en:
Sarapia works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a business, selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years.

Sarapia requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional vegetables to sell, like eggplant, beans, squash, and carrots. She has successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan, to further build her business.

In the future, Sarapia would like to build and expand her business, to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell, like eggplant, beans, squash, and carrots

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 34 years old and married, and she has three children. She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. She has been farming coconut for eight years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

Alma is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies for her coconut-growing business

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 25 years old and single. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for three years, and she earns additional income from a motorcycle transport business.

Maricel is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
María, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo, este le servirá para comprar papas, platanos, aceite, maíz, entre otros ingredientes, todo por mayor.
Con el crédito anterior logro cubrir la demanda y tener una mayor estabilidad; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en: Maria needs to take out a new loan because she needs more working capital. This is help her buy wholesale potatoes, bananas, oil, and corn, among other ingredients. With the previous loan, she was able to meet demand and have greater stability. The economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy wholesale potatoes, bananas, oil, and corn, among other ingredients.

loans.name: Jaime Amador

texts.es: Con el crédito obtenido en Kiva durante la cosecha pasada Jaime pudo sembrar 1000 plantas nuevas de café en su finca, las cuales dentro de dos años más estarán dando sus primeros frutos y de esta forma su producción aumentará. Para darle continuidad al trabajo que viene realizando Jaime necesita de otro crédito, pues comprará fertilizante orgánico para su finca y también planea resembrar otro terreno que adquirió hace algún tiempo.
texts.en: With the credit obtained from Kiva, Jaime was able to sow 1000 coffee plants on his farm at the last harvest.  These plants will bear their first fruit within two years and in this way, his production will increase.  In order to provide continuity to the work being done, Jaime needs another loan.  He will purchase organic fertilizer for his farm and he also plans to re-sow other land that he acquired some time ago.  .

loans.use: to re-sow his land and purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Con un crédito de Kiva Javier pudo pagar a los jornaleros que le ayudaron en los trabajos en su finca durante la cosecha pasada. Para esta cosecha Javier necesita de otro financiamiento por parte de Kiva ya que comprará fertilizante y también utilizará parte de ese dinero para el pago de trabajadores que lo ayuden a hacer algunas actividades en su parcela. Con las ganancias que obtenga el final de la cosecha Javier pagará este crédito.
texts.en:
With a loan from Kiva, Javier could pay field hands that helped him with work on his farm during the last harvest.  For this harvest, Javier needs another loan from Kiva.  He will buy fertilizer and also will use part of this money to pay workers that help him complete some activities on his plot.

With his earnings obtained at the end of the harvest, Javier will pay this credit.

loans.use: to hire field hands.

loans.name: Benkadi  I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du  BENKADI  I sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kantola un des villages de la commune de Guégnaka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont culture de l’arachide, du mil et du sésame. Elles sont à leur quatrième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  Ramatou  la personne au milieu dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice de 95 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "BENKADI I" are married women, who average 36 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Kantola, a village in Commune de Guégnaka, Préfecture de Dioïla, in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the rainy season. And they are on their fourth collaboration with the institution. The crops grown are peanuts, millet, and sesame.

With this loan, Ramatou, who is sitting in the middle of her row, intends to purchase farm inputs and tools and to cover the cost of plowing to maintain 1 hectare of millet and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Fana City to men and women customers. She hopes to make a profit of about 95,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, weeding, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Benkadi  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe BENKADI II sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kantola un des villages de   préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont culture de l’arachide, du mil et du sésame. Elles sont à leur quatrième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  Sadio  1 ère  à gauche dans le rang des débout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice de 100. 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "BENKADI II" are married women, who average 37 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Kantola, a village in Dioïla prefecture, in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the rainy season. And they are on their fourth collaboration with the institution. The crops grown are peanuts, millet, and sesame.

With this loan, Sadio, who is the first person standing from the left in the photo, intends to purchase farm inputs and tools and to cover the cost of plowing to maintain 1 hectare of millet and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Fana City to men and women customers. She hopes to make a profit of about 100,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, weeding, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 33 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Dioïla quartier Tripano, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habillements en majorité.                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente Djenebou, 1 ère à droite des  personnes debout, fait la vente d’habits pour enfants. Elle compte avoir avec son prêt quelques de complets d’habits pour enfants auprès des grossistes de Bamako. Elle vend au comptant quelques fois à crédit.  Elle a une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle envisage après toutes dépenses réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi is composed of married women, who average 33 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional extended families in Dioïla, Tripano district, Dioïla prefecture, in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in clothing for the most part. The group members are on their fourth solidarity loan.

This client, Djenebou, who is the first person standing from the right, sells children's clothing. With her loan, she plans to obtain a few children's outfits from Bamako wholesalers. She makes her sales in cash and sometimes on credit. Her customer base is composed of both men and women. 

After any expenses, she envisions making an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs. Part of the profits will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years, and she earns additional income from a food vending business.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF. She will use it to purchase tools and equipment for her fishing business. Marianita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment for her fishing business

loans.name: Gil Amado

texts.es: Durante la última cosecha Gil Amado adquirió una chapeadora para limpiar sus fincas y además, gracias a un crédito obtenido por parte de Kiva, tuvo la oportunidad de resembrar parte de su terreno que ya no estaba produciendo lo suficiente debido a que las plantas tenían bastantes años. Parte de las ganancias que obtuvo al final de la cosecha las invirtió en otras actividades alternas que tiene. Para la siguiente cosecha Gil Amado necesita un crédito pues debe fertilizar estas nuevas plantas y en un periodo de dos años su producción crecerá aún más.
texts.en: During the last crop season, Gil Amado bought a mower to clear his lands and thanks to the loan he received through Kiva, he was able to re-seed part of his land, which wasn't producing enough because the plans were several years old.  Part of the earnings obtained were invested in other activities that he does.  For the next crop season Gil Amado needs a loan to fertilize new plants and in two years his production will grow even more.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: El año pasado Jesús compró planta de café para renovar sus fincas y abono orgánico y gracias a esto logró tener una buena producción, la cual entregó en su totalidad a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco”, asociación a la cual pertenece desde hace algunos años. Para la siguiente cosecha Jesús renovará otra parte de sus cafetales ya que tiene algunas plantas que ya han cumplido su ciclo productivo de vida. Para hacer la renovación él necesita de otro financiamiento por parte de Kiva el cual pagará al final de la cosecha.
texts.en: Last year, Jesús bought coffee plants to renew his farms as well as organic fertilizer and thanks to this, he had a good production.  He delivered the entire amount to the “Unión Regional de Huatusco”[coffee cooperative], an association to which he has belonged for many years.  For the next harvest, Jesús will renew another part of his coffee plantation because he has some plants that have completed their productive life cycle.  In order to do the renewal, he needs another loan form Kiva, which he will pay at the end of the harvest.

loans.use: to renew his coffee farm.

loans.name: Alejandro
